org.apache.juneau.jsonschema.annotation

Annotation Type JsonSchemaConfig


  • @Documented
 @Target(value={TYPE,METHOD})
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Inherited
 @PropertyStoreApply(value=JsonSchemaConfigApply.class)
public @interface JsonSchemaConfig
    Annotation for specifying config properties defined in JsonSchemaGenerator.

    Used primarily for specifying bean configuration properties on REST classes and methods.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String addDescriptionsTo
      Configuration property: Add descriptions to types.
      String addExamplesTo
      Configuration property: Add examples.
      String allowNestedDescriptions
      Configuration property: Allow nested descriptions.
      String allowNestedExamples
      Configuration property: Allow nested examples.
      Schema[] applySchema
      Dynamically applies @Schema annotations to specified classes/methods/fields.
      Class<? extends BeanDefMapper> beanDefMapper
      Configuration property: Bean schema definition mapper.
      CS[] defaultSchemas
      Configuration property: Default schemas.
      String ignoreTypes
      Configuration property: Ignore types from schema definitions.
      int rank
      Optional rank for this config.
      String useBeanDefs
      Configuration property: Use bean definitions.

    • Element Detail

      • rank

        public abstract int rank
        Optional rank for this config.

        Can be used to override default ordering and application of config annotations.

        Default:
        0

      • addDescriptionsTo

        public abstract String addDescriptionsTo
        Configuration property: Add descriptions to types.

        Identifies which categories of types that descriptions should be automatically added to generated schemas.

        The description is the result of calling ClassMeta.getFullName().

        • The format is a comma-delimited list of any of the following values:
          • "BEAN"
          • "COLLECTION"
          • "ARRAY"
          • "MAP"
          • "STRING"
          • "NUMBER"
          • "BOOLEAN"
          • "ANY"
          • "OTHER"
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • JsonSchemaGenerator.JSONSCHEMA_addDescriptionsTo
        Default:
        ""

      • addExamplesTo

        public abstract String addExamplesTo
        Configuration property: Add examples.

        Identifies which categories of types that examples should be automatically added to generated schemas.

        The examples come from calling ClassMeta.getExample(BeanSession) which in turn gets examples from the following:

        • Example
        • BeanContext.BEAN_examples
        • The format is a comma-delimited list of any of the following values:
          • "BEAN"
          • "COLLECTION"
          • "ARRAY"
          • "MAP"
          • "STRING"
          • "NUMBER"
          • "BOOLEAN"
          • "ANY"
          • "OTHER"
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • JsonSchemaGenerator.JSONSCHEMA_addDescriptionsTo
        Default:
        ""

      • allowNestedDescriptions

        public abstract String allowNestedDescriptions
        Configuration property: Allow nested descriptions.

        Identifies whether nested descriptions are allowed in schema definitions.

        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • JsonSchemaGenerator.JSONSCHEMA_allowNestedDescriptions
        Default:
        ""

      • allowNestedExamples

        public abstract String allowNestedExamples
        Configuration property: Allow nested examples.

        Identifies whether nested examples are allowed in schema definitions.

        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • JsonSchemaGenerator.JSONSCHEMA_allowNestedExamples
        Default:
        ""

      • applySchema

        public abstract Schema[] applySchema
        Dynamically applies @Schema annotations to specified classes/methods/fields.

        Provides an alternate approach for applying annotations using @Schema.on to specify the names to apply the annotation to.

        • Overview > juneau-marshall > Dynamically Applied Annotations
        Default:
        {}

      • beanDefMapper

        public abstract Class<? extends BeanDefMapper> beanDefMapper
        Configuration property: Bean schema definition mapper.

        Interface to use for converting Bean classes to definition IDs and URIs.

        Used primarily for defining common definition sections for beans in Swagger JSON.

        • This setting is ignored if JsonSchemaGenerator.JSONSCHEMA_useBeanDefs is not enabled.
        • JsonSchemaGenerator.JSONSCHEMA_beanDefMapper
        Default:
        org.apache.juneau.jsonschema.BeanDefMapper.Null.class

      • defaultSchemas

        public abstract CS[] defaultSchemas
        Configuration property: Default schemas.

        Allows you to override or provide custom schema information for particular class types.

        • Keys are the class.
          Values are Simple-JSON objects.
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • JsonSchemaGenerator.JSONSCHEMA_defaultSchemas
        Default:
        {}

      • ignoreTypes

        public abstract String ignoreTypes
        Configuration property: Ignore types from schema definitions.

        Defines class name patterns that should be ignored when generating schema definitions in the generated Swagger documentation.

        • Format: Comma-delimited list of patterns
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • JsonSchemaGenerator.JSONSCHEMA_ignoreTypes
        Default:
        ""

      • useBeanDefs

        public abstract String useBeanDefs
        Configuration property: Use bean definitions.

        When enabled, schemas on beans will be serialized as the following:

        { type: 'object', '$ref': '#/definitions/TypeId' }

        The definitions can then be retrieved from the session using JsonSchemaGeneratorSession.getBeanDefs().

        Definitions can also be added programmatically using JsonSchemaGeneratorSession.addBeanDef(String, ObjectMap).

        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • JsonSchemaGenerator.JSONSCHEMA_useBeanDefs
        Default:
        ""
